project.teaser: The EU roadmap towards a climate-neutral economy by 2050 sets ambitious decarbonisation targets that shall be achieved by a massive deployment of renewable energy sources. Energy storage improves grid flexibility and allows higher penetration levels of renewable energy sources...
project.objective: The EU roadmap towards a climate-neutral economy by 2050 sets ambitious decarbonisation targets that shall be achieved by a massive deployment of renewable energy sources. Energy storage improves grid flexibility and allows higher penetration levels of renewable energy sources to create a decarbonised and more electrified society by means of leveraging second-life batteries. Battery management plays an essential role by ensuring an efficient and safe battery operation. However, current battery management systems (BMS) typically rely on semi-empirical battery models (such as equivalent-circuit models) and on a limited amount of measured data. Therefore, ENERGETIC project aims to develop the next generation BMS for optimizing batteries’ systems utilisation in the first (transport) and the second life (stationary) in a path towards more reliable, powerful and safer operations. ENERGETIC project contributes to the field of translational enhanced sensing technologies, exploiting multiple Artificial Intelligence models, supported by Edge and Cloud computing. ENERGETIC’s vision not only encompasses monitoring and prognosis the remaining useful life of a Li-ion battery with a digital twin, but also encompasses diagnosis by scrutinising the reasons for degradation through investigating the explainable AI models. This involves development of new technologies of sensing, combination and validation of multiphysics and data driven models, information fusion through Artificial Intelligence, Real time testing and smart Digital Twin development. Based on a solid and interdisciplinary consortium of partners, the ENERGETIC R&D project develops innovative physics and data-based approaches both at the software and hardware levels to ensure an optimised and safe utilisation of the battery system during all modes of operation.
project.title: NEXT GENERATION BATTERY MANAGEMENT SYSTEM BASED ON DATA RICH DIGITAL TWIN
project.keywords: Battery Management Systems, Digital Twins, AI, Battery Sensors, Cloud and Edge Computing, Data driven models, Multiphysics Models

article.title: AI-powered battery management for greener energy

result.title: AI model for heat monitoring
result.description: A description of the proposed model architecture will be provided. Qualitative and quantitative comparison with SoA will also be reported.

result.title: Plan and Strategy for Dissemination and Communication
result.description: This deliverable will establish the basis for the development of common dissemination & exploitation plan in the project. This deliverable is linked with the task T7.1. Updates at M18 and M39.

result.title: OntoSoC: An ontology-based approach to battery pack SoC estimation

details.authors: Ala Eddine Hamouni, Franco Giustozzi, Ahmed Samet, Ali Ayadi, Slimane Arbaoui, Tedjani Mesbahi

result.title: Demonstration of a Hardware Abstraction Layer featuring expanded set of inputs
result.description: Hardware Abstraction framework on an embedded device capable of sensoring battery sensor signals and delivering an abstraction for upper layers resp. network transfer.

result.title: New methods of resilient of data transmission
result.description: A new approach to develop blockchain services in the form of Network Function Virtualizations that can improve both maintainability and deployability of IoT networks. In addition, it enables sophisticated analysis of IoT transactions, improves security, and increases privacy, thanks to the global network awareness.

result.title: Mining model from explanation of AI models
result.description: The algorithm used to mine explanation from the model. A expert evaluation of the explanation is given as well.

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - ENERGETIC (NEXT GENERATION BATTERY MANAGEMENT SYSTEM BASED ON DATA RICH DIGITAL TWIN)
result.teaser: Current battery management systems (BMS) typically rely on semi-empirical battery models (such as equivalent-circuit models) and on a limited amount of measured data. In fact, a battery’s first life lasts between 10-15 years and is likely to retain more than two-thirds of...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Parameter Estimation for a Generic Na-ion Battery Model Using The Curve Fitting Approach

details.authors: Lakhdar Mamouri, Thomas Pavot, Tedjani Mesbahi
details.journalTitle: 2024 IEEE Vehicle Power and Propulsion Conference (VPPC)

result.title: Toward Anomaly Representation in Lithium-Ion Batteries: An Ontology-Based Approach

details.authors: Marwa Zitouni, Franco Giustozzi, Ahmed Samet, Tedjani Mesbahi

result.title: Technical report on battery sizing methodologies for optimising first and second lives
result.description: "The ""battery first life"" configuration for current electric vehicle applications is our first point of interest. Second, the report outlines the methodology used to size ""battery second life."" Depending on the application type and energy management strategy, the to-be-developed sizing tools are meant to direct the designer in his decisions."

result.title: Benchmark service providers
result.description: Various research will be done to compare data’s security and storage, sustainability, infrastructures, environment and architecture of the different cloud providers in order to identify the solution best suited to our requirements and needs.

result.title: Hysteresis in Sodium-ion Batteries: Temperature and Relaxation Time Effects

details.authors: Sary Yehia, Lakhdar Mamouri, Nagham El Ghossein, Tedjani Mesbahi
details.journalTitle: 2024 IEEE Vehicle Power and Propulsion Conference (VPPC)

result.title: AI-enabled thermal monitoring of commercial (PHEV) Li-ion pouch cells with Feature-Adapted Unsupervised Anomaly Detection

details.authors: Abdelrahman Shabayek, Arunkumar Rathinam, Matthieu Ruthven, Djamila Aouada, Tazdin Amietszajew

result.title: Benchmark of multiphysics models of battery systems including cooling
result.description: Report detailing existing multiphysics models of battery systems including cooling. Including aspect of cell modelling and how this is extended to sytem modelling including cooling system.

result.title: Ontology of the battery domain integrating the BMS definition and the concept of failures and maintenance
result.description: A descrption of the built ontlogy and the different retained battery failure. The different used semantic rule of the ontology are described.

result.title: Design of an Alternative Hardware Abstraction Layer for Embedded Systems with Time-Controlled Hardware Access

details.authors: Gabriel Simmann, Vinay Veeranna, Reiner Kriesten

result.title: Training programme
result.description: Report on monthly seminars that will be organized. A summer school will be organized in Tallinn (June 2025)

result.title: Use cases for automotive and stationary
result.description: This deliverable will define and present the both use cases : auto & stationnary, which will be used for first life and second life applications of batteries.

result.title: Data-driven strategy for state of health prediction and anomaly detection in lithium-ion batteries

details.authors: Slimane Arbaoui, Ahmed Samet, Ali Ayadi, Tedjani Mesbahi, Romuald Boné

result.title: AI model for SoX prediction
result.description: A description of the architecture of the used model for predicting the SoX. A comparative results with the State of the Art wil be given.

result.title: Simulated thermal images to train AI
result.description: A simulator for generating synthetic thermal images will be developed. This will enable producing a dataset formed by simulated thermal images that will be in turn used for training AI models.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
